archdesc.bioghist: Born in Port Huron, Mich., Edward Charles Bassett earned his Bachelor of Science in Architecture from the University of Michigan in 1949, and Master of Arts in Architecture from Cranbrook Academy of Art in 1951. From 1955 to 1981 he worked at the San Francisco office of Skidmore, Owings & Merrill. In 1977, Bassett was elected to the College of Fellows of the American Institute of Architects.
archdesc.scopecontent: Student notebooks, transcript of oral history interview, and architectural sketches. The sketches are untitled, but many are identified in the book "Edward Charles Bassett, 1921-1999, A Collection of his Drawings," which is contained in the collection. The sketches include a drawing of the Detroit Civic Center plan and several studies of the water tower at the General Motors Technical Center.
